titulo: Saúde e Educação: Impactos no Cérebro
descricao: Este módulo explora a relação entre educação, saúde cerebral, e o conceito de reserva cognitiva, com base em um texto acadêmico.
texto_base:
1- Few would doubt the benefits of education. People who graduate from high school tend to earn more, and generally have more choices and a better quality of life than those who do not, and for those who finish college, the benefits are even bigger. A good education may have other advantages. Research published in the past few years suggests that it can strengthen the brain, making it more resistant to the ravages of old age, and perhaps mitigating the damage that occurs after traumatic brain injury. Research into the link between education and dementia began in the mid-1980s and evidence suggests that a higher level of educational attainment is associated with both a decreased risk of Alzheimer's disease and age-related cognitive decline. They also point that education beyond high school is more strongly associated with better lifelong brain health outcomes in blacks than whites.

2- Level of education is often closely associated with socioeconomic status, and the relationship between the two confounded the results obtained in some of the earlier studies, but more recent findings show that they are indeed independent of one another, and that education is by far the more significant factor in brain health. Level of education may also accurately predict the extent to which one will recover following traumatic brain injury (TBI). Researchers from Johns Hopkins Medical School tracked the progress of 800 patients, all of whom had been admitted for rehabilitation after moderate to severe TBI. The results show that the more highly educated a patient was, the more likely they were to recover and be free from disability. Many researchers explain findings such as these in terms of cognitive reserve, a concept that stems from observations that some people can continue to function normally despite brain pathology.

3-The term 'cognitive reserve' was first used in a 1988 study, in which researchers from the University of California, San Diego examined the brains of 137 nursing home residents, all of whom had undergone neuropsychological testing before they died. While 10 of these people remained cognitively healthy and outperformed healthy individuals on the tests-post-mortem, examination revealed in their brains pathological changes associated with Alzheimer's. These people also had heavier brains and more neurons than both the demented and healthy residents included, leading the researchers to hypothesize that these extra brain cells provided a 'reserve' that made them better at dealing with the damage caused by the disease.

GLOSSARY
To strengthen: to fortify
Attainment: achievement
Outcomes: results

exercicios.pergunta: De acordo com o texto base, qual benefício adicional de uma boa educação é sugerido por pesquisas recentes?
opcoes: Fortalecer o cérebro, tornando-o mais resistente aos efeitos da idade
Aumentar o número de amigos na velhice
Melhorar a memória para eventos passados
exercicios.resposta_correta: Fortalecer o cérebro, tornando-o mais resistente aos efeitos da idade
exercicios.explicacao: O texto afirma: 'Research published in the past few years suggests that it can strengthen the brain, making it more resistant to the ravages of old age'.

exercicios.pergunta: A pesquisa sobre a ligação entre educação e demência começou na década de 1980 e sugere que um nível mais alto de escolaridade está associado a um risco diminuído de Alzheimer e declínio cognitivo relacionado à idade. (VERDADEIRO/FALSO)
exercicios.explicacao: O texto diz: 'Research into the link between education and dementia began in the mid-1980s and evidence suggests that a higher level of educational attainment is associated with both a decreased risk of Alzheimer's disease and age-related cognitive decline'.

exercicios.pergunta: No contexto do texto base, a que o pronome 'it' se refere na frase 'A good education may have other advantages. Research published in the past few years suggests that it can strengthen the brain'?
exercicios.explicacao: No PDF original, a Questão 3 (pág. 21) indica que 'it' se refere a 'A good education'.

exercicios.pergunta: Qual a relação entre o nível de educação e o status socioeconômico, de acordo com o texto base?
opcoes: São fatores independentes e a educação é o mais significativo para a saúde cerebral
O status socioeconômico é o fator mais relevante
A relação é confusa e não pode ser determinada
exercicios.resposta_correta: São fatores independentes e a educação é o mais significativo para a saúde cerebral
exercicios.explicacao: O texto diz: 'more recent findings show that they are indeed independent of one another, and that education is by far the more significant factor in brain health'.

exercicios.pergunta: A recuperação após uma lesão cerebral traumática (TBI) moderada a grave está relacionada ao nível de educação do paciente. (VERDADEIRO/FALSO)
exercicios.explicacao: O texto afirma: 'The results show that the more highly educated a patient was, the more likely they were to recover and be free from disability'.

exercicios.pergunta: Qual o termo em inglês que se refere a um conceito que 'stems from observations that some people can continue to function normally despite brain pathology'?
exercicios.explicacao: O texto explica 'Many researchers explain findings such as these in terms of cognitive reserve, a concept that stems from observations that some people can continue to function normally despite brain pathology'.

exercicios.pergunta: A palavra 'stems' (derivada de) no texto base é mais próxima em significado de qual alternativa?
exercicios.explicacao: No PDF original, a Questão 6 (pág. 22) indica que 'stems' pode ser substituída por 'Derives'.

exercicios.pergunta: O termo 'cognitive reserve' foi usado pela primeira vez em um estudo de 1988 que examinou apenas os cérebros de residentes com demência. (VERDADEIRO/FALSO)
exercicios.explicacao: O estudo examinou '137 nursing home residents, all of whom had undergone neuropsychological testing before they died', incluindo pessoas que permaneceram cognitivamente saudáveis.

exercicios.pergunta: No estudo de 1988, quais características cerebrais foram encontradas em pessoas que permaneceram cognitivamente saudáveis apesar de mudanças patológicas associadas ao Alzheimer?
respostas_aceitas: cérebros mais pesados e mais neurônios
exercicios.explicacao: 'These people also had heavier brains and more neurons than both the demented and healthy residents included'.

exercicios.pergunta: Qual a ideia principal do texto base?

A idade afeta o nível educacional

exercicios.explicacao: No PDF original, a Questão 10 (pág. 25) indica a resposta correta como 'A good education may have positive effects in aging, mental diseases and brain injury'.

exercicios.pergunta: O estudo da Universidade da Califórnia em San Diego de 1988 mostrou que 10 dos 137 residentes permaneceram cognitivamente saudáveis e superaram indivíduos saudáveis nos testes. (VERDADEIRO/FALSO)
exercicios.explicacao: 'While 10 of these people remained cognitively healthy and outperformed healthy individuals on the tests'.

exercicios.pergunta: No parágrafo 3 do texto base, a quem se refere o pronome 'their' na frase 'examination revealed in their brains pathological changes associated with Alzheimer's'?
exercicios.explicacao: No PDF original, a Questão 7 (pág. 23) indica que 'their' se refere a '10 of these people'.

exercicios.pergunta: Qual das seguintes afirmações é correta, segundo o texto base?
opcoes: Pessoas com mais educação tendem a se recuperar melhor de lesão cerebral traumática.

exercicios.resposta_correta: Pessoas com mais educação tendem a se recuperar melhor de lesão cerebral traumática.
exercicios.explicacao: No PDF original, a Questão 1 (pág. 20) indica a resposta correta como 'People with more education tend to recover better from traumatic brain injury'.
